analysis.summary: MusicHome.vue defines the landing page for the music section of the application. It renders a hero banner and four content sections: featured playlists, new releases, popular tracks, and top artists. Each section uses a Feed component to fetch and display data, rendering cards or lists via scoped slots.
analysis.purpose: Serve as the main music home page, orchestrating data fetching and presentation of key music entities (playlists, albums, tracks, artists) via reusable components.

components.name: Feed
components.responsibility: Generic data-fetching and display wrapper. Accepts items via v-model, shows loading/skeleton UI, and provides a scoped slot for rendering.

components.name: PlaylistCard
components.responsibility: Displays a single playlist item with cover art and title.

components.name: AlbumCard
components.responsibility: Displays a single album item with cover art and title.

components.name: TrackList
components.responsibility: Renders a list of tracks, optionally showing album info and cover art.

components.name: ArtistCard
components.responsibility: Displays a single artist item with avatar and name.

functions.name: onMounted hook
functions.purpose: Fetch initial data for featured playlists, recent albums, popular tracks, and top artists when component mounts.

analysis.usage: Registered as the view component for the '/music' route in the router configuration. Imported by the application's music module routing file to render the music home page.
notes: Uses scoped slots in Feed to customize rendering per section.
Skeleton structures differ per content type (horizontal vs. vertical layouts).
Scoped style defines a dark gradient background for the hero section.
